author: Travis Simpson (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Wildcats rout Magazine on homecoming
text: BY TRAVIS SIMPSONsports@couriernews.comHECTOR — The Hector Wildcats won big on homecoming over the Magazine Rattlers on Friday at Linton Field. Wildcats head coach Mark Taylor said the coaching staff just about everything in their power to prevent the enormously lopsided 67-14 scoreboard, but it was to no avail.“They just laid down and quit in the second half,” Taylor said. “Nothing I could do about that. We played second string all second half. I have very seldom scored more than 50 points in a game. I hated it. I felt bad. We had guys score touchdowns tonight that have never carried the football.”Tanner Gaines opened the scoring from five yards out. Up next, Gaines connected with Jalen Furgeson or a 72-yard touchdown. Furgeson struck again, on defense this time, with a pick-six.Jacob Billingsly scored on a 47-yard run and Gaines connected with Jaden Graham for a 53-yard touchdown.Also making appearances in the end zone were Braxton Hendrix (a 1-yard touchdown carry), James Sims (32-yard carry) and Justin Walker (2-yard touchdown).The Wildcats’ (5-0, 3-0) undefeated 2A-4 Conference streak continues. Hector will host Mountainburg on Friday.
